tier.item: `A bull has been slaughtered for us.'
`A bull has been slaughtered for us.'
A bull has been slaughtered for us.
`We have had a bull slaughtered for us.'
`We have had a bull slaughtered for us.'
We have had a bull slaughtered for us.
a. Walaa mo mi-'annd-aa 'innde muu um.
`There is no one whose name I don't know.'
a. Walaa mo mi-'annd-aa 'innde muu um.
`There is no one whose name I don't know.'
There is no one whose name I don't know.
b. Ndaa go o mo sood-áayi nagge.
`There is someone who has not bought a cow.' (292)
b. Ndaa go o mo sood-áayi nagge.
`There is someone who has not bought a cow.' (292)
Ndaa go o mo sood-áayi nagge.
There is someone who has not bought a cow.

tier.item: `If you haven't brought any money, you won't get anything to eat.'
`If you haven't brought any money, you won't get anything to eat.'
if 2SG-br ing-PNEG money 2SG-get-FU TNEG thing eat
If you haven't brought any money, you won't get anything to eat.
e uu e na? 'aa'aa, e- uu - aa.
`Are they numerous? No, they are not numerous.'
e uu e na? 'aa'aa, e- uu - aa.
`Are they numerous? No, they are not numerous.'
Are they numerous? No, they are not numerous.

tier.item: 1.1 Gombe Fula (spoken in Gombe, Nigeria; Arnott 1970)
Arnott (1970: 366): consonantal verb suffixes are ordered by the formula `TDNR'
`He snatched all my books from me by brute force' (p. 367)
